Description: Fragment of a curtain of mainly undyed and unbleached linen; Plain weave with tapestry on grouped warp threads and tapestry on single warp threads; Design of tapestry motifs, outlining pyramid shapes, in blue, pink and yellow linen and green, red and blue wool; Small petals forms arranged in diagonals and a stripe, two larger leaves and a flower head sit along the stripe and within the pyramids; Weft stripes of whiter linen in ground; Warp: S spun linen, c.9 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S spun, c.7 tpc in undecorated areas, c.24 tpc in tapestry; Edges: two plain selvedges, two torn edges
Curator's comments: Previous location in David Thompson's room 1-1A Montague St; Probably the lower part of a curtain, original lower edge would not be much below existing bottom, no sign of wear. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (17.11.1989)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
